channel.description: Recent content in Private on Andi Altendorfer

item.title: Signs of Winter
item.description:
Signs of Winter

The days grow short, the sun hangs low,
A frosty breath begins to blow.
Leaves of gold and crimson fall,
Bare branches stand, awaiting winter’s call.

The birds are hushed, or fly away,
To warmer lands, they cannot stay.
A quiet hush descends on fields,
As nature’s vibrant color yields.

The air is crisp, a biting chill,
The world prepares, then stands quite still.
For soon the snow will softly creep,
And blanket all in slumber deep.

item.title: Procrastinating Friday
item.description:
/private

The Art of Doing Nothing

It’s Friday. The weekend is so close you can almost taste it. The code editor is open, the terminal is blinking, but my mind is already somewhere else. It’s a classic case of “I should be working, but I’m just staring at the screen.”

I’ve got a list of things to do. Bug fixes, a new feature to spec out, and some documentation to write. But let’s be honest, my motivation is at an all-time low . I’ve already checked my emails, scrolled through my social media feeds, and even organized my desktop icons. Twice.
